# Highlights

* Environmental audits were conducted along six inferred cycling routes in Hamilton.

* Cyclists' perceptions of the routes were explored through photo elicitation.

* Qualitative data can help to understand how objective measures influence cycling.

* Cyclists' perceptions should be regularly explored and incorporated in route design.

* Photo elicitation is a useful participatory approach for developing cycling cities.
